intro: Deinbollia dahomensis, commonly known as the West African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shady habitats and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
